San Jon is located at the crossroads of historic Route 66 (which passes through as Main Street) and New Mexico State Hwy 469 (Interstate 40 exit 356).

value: address=10 mi. S of San Jon

content=Former 955-seat outdoor amphitheatre with concession stand, bleachers and stage north of Clovis NM. Presented live theatre (including 1985 outdoor drama "Billy the Kid") for ten years before closing due to declining audience size. Empty and abandoned by 1997, the village of San Jon proposed to take over the site in 2007. As of 2008, the pavilion and seating areas has been gated off but the remainder of the site was open as rugged terrain for hiking.

There are some services near the I-40 offramp, but options are limited.
Logan, New Mexico (population 1000) is a village at the eastern end of the Ute Reservoir on US Route 54, about twenty miles north of San Jon via NM 469.
There is a hotel, motel and restaurant in this village, which serves as a point of entry to a state park and fishing grounds.
